page.title: 10THE RAILWAY AT GLYNDE
page.content: The{railway}is south of Glynde running through the parishes of Firle and Beddingham. It still runs but it is old and not very welcoming. To get on to the platform you have to cross an {old wooden bridge.}The steps leading down to the platform are old, rickety and full of wood-worm. When you are on the platform you can realize what an {old station}Glynde has. There are two lines, one running to Lewes and Brighton, the other running to Eastbourne. The station is not very big and not very many people work there or use it. For a start there is no ticket-collector and tickets have to be bought at the passengers' destinations. The platform where we waited was nothing but a{stone {shelter.}Across the line is another old shelter for the people getting on to the train going to Eastbourne.
